intro: Coppensia hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's corymbia, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in shrubland or open forest habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has small, narrow leaves and produces fruit that is a woody capsule containing several seeds. Coppensia hookeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
